org.paces.Stata.Input

Class FlatJSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.paces.Stata.Input.FlatJSON
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Queries
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlatStataJSON

    public class FlatJSON
extends java.lang.Object
implements Queries
    Class that creates a flattened representation of JSON data. Although this can be used a bit more broadly, the intented use is to create a flattened representation of the JSON that could then be mapped onto a two dimensional space a bit more easily (e.g., convert the map object into a single row vector of values, a two dimensional array with a column vector of strings and column vector of values, etc...). Flattening the JSON object was the first needed step in this process. Additionally, this class will also provide query functions that are more robust and convenient than the JSONPath standard by using notation used for *nix based file systems (e.g., /element/child/grandchild_#/greatgrandchild/etc...) where a number appended to an element name indicates both the order and the unique value from the JSON (these values are index starting from 1).
    Version:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Billy Buchanan

        parent - A LinkedList of String objects that contain the names of each of the parent generations related to the node.

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public void flatten()
        A no argument overload of the flatten method. This separates the class initialization from the flattening of the data by accessing the member variables containing the data needed to call the parameterized flatten method

      • flatten

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> flatten(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node,
                                                                                       java.lang.Integer currentLevel,
                                                                                       java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> parent)
        Public method used handle recasting ObjectNode types to JsonNode types to overload the descent method
        Parameters:
        node - An JsonNode which will be descended into to determine the depth of nested objects
        currentLevel - The level of the descent where this node occurs
        parent - A string containing the field name for the node; the first level should always be named root. Beyond this, the format of this string will be: root/child_#/grandchild_#/greatgrandchild_#/etc... Where the number appended to the string indicates the depth of the specific node
        Returns:
        a Map object containing the JsonNodes keyed by the generation string.

      • checkEmptyNodes

        protected com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode checkEmptyNodes(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode jn)
        Checks to see if the node is completely empty and returns a missing node in place of a null value if it is.
        Parameters:
        jn - The JsonNode object to inspect
        Returns:
        An object of type JsonNode, which can be a MissingNode type object or any other JsonNode type object.

      • processTerminalNode

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> processTerminalNode(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> generations,
                                                                                                      java.lang.String thisField,
                                                                                                      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode theNode,
                                                                                                      java.lang.Integer depth)
        Creates the Map object that contains a key value pair of the full node lineage and the node object
        Parameters:
        generations - A LinkedList of Strings that holds the descent lineage through the JSON object
        thisField - The name of this terminal node field
        theNode - The object containing the datum
        depth - the descent depth of the current node used to add numeric ID to root level nodes
        Returns:
        A Map where the key contains the descent tree with the field name appended to it.

      • makeGenerationString

        public java.lang.String makeGenerationString(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iter)
        Method used to process and create the generation string used to identify the lineage of a terminal node
        Parameters:
        iter - An iterator created from the parent list object (use the descendingIterator() method on the parent list object).
        Returns:
        Returns a String object with all the generations with path delimiters separating them

      • checkName

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> checkName(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> lineage,
                                                         java.lang.String fieldName)
        Method used to implement logic related to lineage of data element being represented in the LinkedList of string elements
        Parameters:
        lineage - The LinkedList of String elements containing the field names from all generations prior to the current generation.
        fieldName - The name of the field to add to the generation string
        Returns:
        Returns the LinkedList with the appropriate handling of the new field name being added to the stack.

      • queryRange

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> queryRange(java.lang.String pattern)
        This method will first call the queryIdx method of the QueryIndex interface and then will combine the minimum and maximum values of the returned indices.
        Specified by:
        queryRange in interface Queries
        Parameters:
        pattern - A regular expression used to query JSON elements
        Returns:
        A two element list containing the minimum and maximum indices that match the given string.
